intro: Neowimmeria costata, commonly known as the serrated wimmera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Neowimmeria costata is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in shrublands and open woodlands.
